data.title: Added CanvasItem::set_visible method
data.body: Can toggle CanvasItem through a boolean rather than separate calls to show and hide. Functionally just a wrapper for the two methods.

data.title: _init and inheritance.  Expected 1 arguments.
Rename collision layers
data.body: A 10x2 checkbox isn't very helpful to indicate what layer is what. It would be helpful to be able to rename each layer so you know what they're for.

data.title: [Feature Request] export(Mask)
data.body: Being able to set masks, such as collision layers, in the editor with an export variable

data.title: disable_3d=yes compile option results in linker errors
data.body: Having disable_3d as a parameter for scons results in linker errors when compiling.

data.title: 32 bit release_debug Windows export crashes. 32 bit debug export works.
data.body:
Doesn't matter whether on Windows 32 or 64 bit. The non-debug export always crashes after the splash screen.

Both exports in a ZIP:
http://www.mediafire.com/download/pmbri2nb2pfc27q/No_Rest_for_the_Wicked_Ones_-_DEMO_v0.96_-_win.32_-_testing_crash.zip

data.title: too many scene tabs breaks layout
data.body:
Add enough tabs that they fill they extend beyong the width of the window, and the dock on the right will be pushed halfway off screen, as well as the rightmost scene tabs and other elements like the settings button on the top right.

Ubuntu 13.10, X11

data.title: added support for mirrored repeat texture wrapping
Re-organize files from within Godot while keeping connections
data.body:
Like the title says, since Godot 1.2 is focusing on usability, I think what would increase the usability by quite a bit is to add re-organization functionality in the file browser window (functionality that will keep all of the connections intact if possible)

---
## BENEFITS::
- Less need to plan ahead as the game is worked on
- Vastly increased ability to keep a project organized as it grows (without requiring hours of work to re-connect everything).
- Gives more room for experimentation
- More accessibility to people who aren't seasoned game developers

I hope you will find this a good idea, as I think file-structure management is an important thing to have in any creation software.

data.title: Remove keyframing for CollisionShape
data.body:
It's a little bit confusing, and I take two days to understand that collision shape can't be animate in game.

By the way, some information may be useful in the class doc, like the use of the trigger, and the non usage of animation in game.

data.title: Exporting / Importing new tileset.xml does not work properly
data.body:
Step to reproduce it:
1. Create a tileset_edit as suggested on the tutorial
2. Load it into a (level) scene and use it in a Tilemap node
3. Modify the tileset_edit (e.g. delete some tiles) and re-export
4. Go back on your level scene: you'll see that the tilemap has not been reloaded properly

This continue to happen even if you clear the current "Tile Set" on your level and try to reload it.

data.title: organizing script tab
data.body:
Ok, now there is a script list on script tab and this is very nice, except that if you have a huge list of scripts you will have a hard time finding it.

Some suggestions:
A simple search feature.
A filter feature.
A category feature, that would work with the filter. You would mark scripts in categories so if you put a script on player category you would just see scripts from various nodes that you marked as player.
A script could be in more than one category, for example: player and movement.

data.title: Tiny typo
data.body: COPY_MODE_DISALED -> COPY_MODE_DISABLED

data.title: Add documentation for RayCast2D about is_colliding and get_collider quirks
data.body:
At first, I thought get_collider() wouldn't return anything if the object it was pointing to wasn't in contact with it, but it turns out this isn't the case (though I suppose this would be useful for cases like wind tunnels). So I added some documentation for get_collider() and is_collidiing() to help clarify this.

If it's a bug, I'll go open a ticket for that too.

data.title: Billboards were displayed upside down when drawn to a render texture
data.body:
Render texture's view transforms seem to be inverted, so when drawing
billboards, the 'up' vector given to set_look_at() is also inverted and
so the billboard gets drawn upside down.

data.title: Godot doesn't remember the files view I choose
data.body: Whenever I open a scene or choose a texture file I need to choose I want to see my files as list again, instead of thumbnails grid. Godot seems not to remember my decision.

data.title: Tilemaps don't keep collision masks
data.body: I tried to set custom collision masks on tiles belonging to tilesets, but once I import them in a level I notice that collisions don't work properly. Can someone confirm the issue?

data.title: (*) indicator doesn't go away after save
data.body: If I make changes to a scene then (*) gets put in the tab, and after saving, it doesn't go away. As a habitual saver with a little OCD, this drives me nuts. :)

data.title: Search and filter node on Scene tab
data.body:
there should be a way to search and filter the nodes on the scene tab.
I have a scene with a LOT of nodes and in the game i an devoloping having scenes with hundredes of nodes will be very common.

data.title: Add simpler  way for user signal exposure in editor
data.body:
Exposing user defined signals in editor should be done without adding tool keyword and writing code that will bypass game logic.

I think that adding _register_user_signals() callback would do it without too much issues. It could be called after init in editor and in game. This should not break any existing code.

Thanks!

data.title: RigidBody should be able to use not only direct children CollisionShapes
data.body:
RigidBody should be able to use not only direct children CollisionShapes for collision prevention.
This probably should be possible to specify somehow, probably via implementation of
proxy nodes. In this case the following setup should work for collision prevention:
RigidBody
---Skeleton
------BoneAttachment
---------CollisionShape

For worm-like creatures this would be awesome :)

data.title: BoneAttachment needs care
data.body:
Bone attachment is node, which is intended to be used as parent to things attached to bones,
like CollisionShapes/Areas and "hats"/"weapons". But currently it is extremely uncear how to use it.
On earlier versions it was used like on video on youtube which I still use as sole reference on
3D setup in Godot: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZyTIiwfn2ag

The problem is that this usage is not flexible as it very much depends on node tree.
The best usage for this should be like physics joints - ability to specify used Skeleton, bone, and affected object (this one can be direct child, allright, but Skeleton should not necessarily be the direct parent of BoneAttachment

data.title: Fixed compilation on MacOS X
data.body: Was unable to compile Godot on MacOS X 10.7.5 (Lion). I am not an Objective-C developer, but I believe the change is semantically equivalent to the original code.

data.title: Ctrl+Drag to rotate collides with Ctrl+Click to add point in Path2D
data.body:
Ctrl+Drag to rotate node,
Ctrl+Click to add point in Path2D.

They collide with each other, so when you want to rotate path2d node you add a new point instead, which is quite annoying.

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer should be usable on large number of animations
data.body:
It is very hard to visually edit animations in AnimationTreePlayer when there is over 30 of them.

AnimationTreePlayer should implement (some of) the following to be easily used for any number of animations:
- Node groups - parts of node sets should be groupable with ability to use as single entity (and still edit). Some animatiions use some 'blend pattern' with others, so these should be probably reusable.
- Interoperation between several AnimationTreePlayers -
  several AnimationTreePlayers could be running in parallel on the same set of object with
  standard AnimationTreePlayer blend modes and filters.
- Ability to drive single output pin to multiple input pins in nodes without requirement of copying
  nodes, even if internally they will be copied, as this really de-clutters visual node display
  getting rid of copies.

data.title: Missing description in the documentation for Array.append() function
data.body:
On this wiki page:
https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/class_array

there is link for the **append** function, but no description available.
Also there is no description in Godot Help screen - Array class description.

Sorry if this issue duplicates another one.

data.title: Added helper methods to InputEvent
data.body: Added helper methods for InputEvent to detect first press and release actions. Could be done before, but this makes it nicer and more clear to write. Would like to amend the in-editor documentation to explain the new methods.

data.title: Thread function can not have no arguments
